v.content: The lunar distance is on average approximately 385,000 km (239,000 mi), or 1.28 light-seconds; this is roughly 30 times Earth's diameter or 9.5 times Earth's ...

v.title: Moon
v.content: The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite. It orbits at an average distance of 384,400 km (238,900 mi), about 30 times the diameter of Earth.

v.title: Supermoon
v.content: A supermoon is a full moon or a new moon that nearly coincides with perigee—the closest that the Moon comes to the Earth in its orbit ...

v.title: Apsis
v.content: ∗Periapsis and apoapsis as distances: the smallest and largest distances between the orbiter and its host body. There are two apsides in any elliptic orbit.

v.title: Moon illusion
